item.description:
A new summertime hot spot brought to you by the owners of top establishments in the Boston area, including The Warren Tavern and Devlin's. Situated in a renovated textile mill, Barlow's has a cool feel from its lofty open beamed ceiling and the warm character of original exposed brick.

We've reserved their large terrace if the weather is good and a dedicated space in the bar if the weather is questionable.

Light appetizers will be provided compliments of Sitzundjibers.

 

Directions:

Just 5 minutes and 2 turns from South Station with validated parking for $3.00

1. Take Summer Street to Melcher (.03 mi)

2. At the light turn right onto Melcher

3. At the end of the street, turn right onto A Street. (.01)

4. Follow along to Barlow's on the right at 241 A Street 5. Parking available across the street on Binford Street- $3.00 validated by Barlow's.
item.name: Getting down (up) at Barlow's
